summary: Brief introductions and role-based offers to help: PM Sarah offered coordination, Architect Mike asked for architecture blockers/decisions/risks, Developer Alex offered to address implementation blockers, and QA Jordan requested notifications or expected outputs for testing.

actions.task: Add expected output to tickets and mark items 'Ready for testing' when implementation is complete
Run tests when items are marked 'Ready for testing' or when expected output is provided
Identify and share any architecture blockers or decisions that need addressing
Coordinate team support and help unblock issues as they arise

risks.risk: Missing or unclear expected outputs for features causing delays in QA and test execution
risks.mitigation: Developers should add expected outputs to tickets and mark items 'Ready for testing' before handing off to QA
Architect to surface architecture blockers early and schedule follow-up discussions if needed

risks.risk: Implementation blockers not escalated causing stalled work
risks.mitigation: Developers should escalate blockers to PM and Architect promptly for coordination and unblocking
